intro: Chaenocephalus lobatus, commonly known as the lobed head plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in a flat, disc-like structure surrounded by ray florets. Chaenocephalus lobatus is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
